mechanics.mana_system: Mana is the primary resource. Cards have mana costs (e.g., {1}{R} = 1 generic + 1 red). Converted mana cost (CMC) is total mana symbols. Lands produce mana.
mechanics.color_system: Five colors: White (W), Blue (U), Black (B), Red (R), Green (G). Color identity determines deckbuilding. Colorless mana ({C}) exists.
mechanics.special_rules: Stack-based spell resolution. Priority system. Life total as resource. Card advantage vs tempo tradeoffs.

terminology.CMC: Converted Mana Cost - total mana symbols
terminology.Oracle Text: Official rules text of a card
terminology.Quadrant Theory: Evaluate cards in: developing, parity, winning, losing board states
terminology.Philosophy of Fire: Direct damage conversion rates (3 damage ≈ 1 card ≈ 1 mana)

archetypes.name: Burn
archetypes.description: Aggressive red deck that wins through direct damage spells
archetypes.strategy: Deal 20 damage as fast as possible using efficient burn spells
archetypes.typical_curve: Low - 20-23 lands, focus on 1-2 CMC spells
archetypes.meta_position: Tier 1-2 in Modern, Tier 2 in Legacy

archetypes.name: Control
archetypes.description: Reactive deck that wins through card advantage and inevitability
archetypes.strategy: Answer threats, accumulate card advantage, win with finisher
archetypes.typical_curve: High - 26-27 lands, focus on 3+ CMC spells
archetypes.meta_position: Tier 1-2 in Legacy, Tier 2-3 in Modern

archetypes.name: Midrange
archetypes.description: Flexible deck that adapts to opponent's strategy
archetypes.strategy: Play efficient threats and answers, outvalue opponent
archetypes.typical_curve: Medium - 24-25 lands, focus on 2-4 CMC spells
archetypes.meta_position: Tier 1-2 in Modern, Tier 2 in Legacy

formats.name: Modern
formats.rotation_schedule: No rotation - only new sets added
formats.meta_context: Diverse format with aggro (Burn, Prowess), midrange (Jund, Rakdos), control (UW Control), and combo (Amulet Titan, Living End) strategies

formats.name: Legacy
formats.meta_context: Powerful format with combo (Storm, Reanimator), control (Miracles), and tempo (Delver) strategies. Force of Will is format-defining

formats.name: Standard
formats.rotation_schedule: Three-year rotation - oldest sets rotate annually
formats.meta_context: Rotating format with current sets. Meta shifts with each new set release

examples.reasoning: Both are 1-mana red instant burn spells dealing 3 damage. Functionally identical in most contexts.
Both are red burn spells, but Bolt is instant and more flexible, while Spike is sorcery and only targets players.
Both are efficient creature removal. Fatal Push is 1-mana black, Path is 1-mana white. Push is better early game, Path is better late game.

temporal_context.current_meta: Modern: Diverse with Burn, Jund, UW Control, Amulet Titan. Legacy: Delver, Miracles, Storm dominant.
temporal_context.recent_bans: No recent bans in Modern or Legacy (as of 2025-01-01)
temporal_context.price_volatility: Winter/summer price drops, fall/spring spikes common
